definition: (onom.) sound of cawing/sound of infant learning to talk/variant of 呀[ya1]
see 謎兒|谜儿[mei4 r5], riddle

sentences.english: I don't know what that is.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道打哑谜是什么。
现在你知道什么是哑谜了。

sentences.english: My male friends never play double games and prefer to tell me the truth.
sentences.chinese: 我的男性朋友们从来不打哑谜，他们喜欢告诉我真相。

sentences.english: The enigma was more impenetrable than ever.
sentences.chinese: 这哑谜越来越猜不透了。

sentences.english: "You speak in riddles, learned sir," said the pale minister, glancing aside out of the window.
sentences.chinese: “你是在打哑谜，博学的先生，”牧师斜瞥着窗外说。

sentences.english: I think your charade is all played out.
sentences.chinese: 我想你的哑谜游戏已经被大家看穿了。

sentences.english: I didn't want to play charades, so they're angry at me.
sentences.chinese: 我不想玩猜哑谜，所以他们都生我的气了。

sentences.english: Carl, now you know charades. Carl.
sentences.chinese: 现在你知道什么是哑谜了。
现在你知道什么是哑谜了。

sentences.english: Sorry, I should stop speaking in riddles.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，我应该停止打哑谜。

sentences.english: Everything about this singular enigma was inexplicable.
sentences.chinese: 所有的一切，在这个离奇的哑谜中，是无法解释的。

definition: to ask a question, already knowing the answer
to have hidden meaning/implication/more than just the apparent meaning/something hinted
overtones in conversation/things indirectly implied from what is said
to be unable to guess or make out
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
to keep listeners in suspense (in storytelling)/to keep people on tenterhooks
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
